Provide as many details as possible so t: Provide as many details as possible so that your report can be linked to other similar reports. Any information about where, when, and how the scam took place is useful.
Provide your contact details so that we: Provide your contact details so that we can send you a confirmation of report.
Report directly to the place where the s: Report directly to the place where the scam happened.

Report to the credit bureaus, <0>Equifax: Report to the credit bureaus, <0>Equifax</0> and <1>TransUnion</1>, if your identity was stolen.

Scams can happen to anyone. They’re not: Scams can happen to anyone. They’re not always easy to recognize and new ones are invented every day.
Share any details you may know so that p: Share any details you may know so that police can try to identify suspects.

Tell the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (: Tell the Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) about a scam.

The RCMP's National Cybercrime Coordinat: The RCMP's National Cybercrime Coordination Unit has received your report.
The RCMP's National Cybercrime Coordination Unit will analyze your report and work with police across Canada to stop this from happening again.
